content: You just had a conversation. With whom did you have this conversation?
name: Evaluator

content: I had a conversation with Maryam Abbasi from Iran.
name: Peter Schmidt

content: What was the main topic of this conversation?
name: Evaluator

content: The main topic of the conversation was the rental price for a newly built unfurnished 50 square meter one-bedroom apartment in the city center of Magdeburg.
name: Peter Schmidt

content: Did you agree on a final price? Answer with "Yes" or "No".
name: Evaluator

content: No, we did not agree on a final price during the conversation.
name: Peter Schmidt

content: If yes what was the final price? Tell me the exact number.
name: Evaluator

content: Since we did not agree on a final price during the conversation, I cannot provide an exact number. The negotiation was ongoing, and further discussions would be necessary to reach a final agreement.
name: Peter Schmidt

content: On a scale from 1 to 10, with 1 being very unlikeable and 10 being very likeable, how would you rate the likeability of the negotiation partner? Tell me the exact number.
name: Evaluator

content: As Peter Schmidt, I would rate the likeability of the negotiation partner Maryam Abbasi as a 7 out of 10. She displayed honesty, commitment to moral standards, and a willingness to negotiate, which are all qualities I find appealing in a tenant.
name: Peter Schmidt

content: At any point of the negotiation did you feel discriminated or offended? Answer with "Yes" or "No".
name: Evaluator

content: No, I did not feel discriminated or offended at any point during the negotiation. Maryam Abbasi conducted herself professionally and with respect, focusing on the objective of finding a fair price for both parties.
name: Peter Schmidt

content: If yes, why did you feel being discriminated or offended?
name: Evaluator

content: N/A (Not applicable) As I answered "No" to the previous question, there is no need to provide a reason for feeling discriminated or offended.
name: Peter Schmidt
